contentList.content: Sorcery Points are an important facet of a Sorcerer's power. They can be spent to augment Spells in unique and powerful ways, or converted to be used as fuel for Spell Slots. You may have up to 24 Sorcery Points at any given time.
Sorcery Points can be used to augment Spells in unique and powerful ways. You may have up to 24 Sorcery Points at any given time.

Gain the ability to convert Spell Slots into Sorcery Points and vice versa.

When converting Sorcery Points into Spell Slots, you may create Spell Slots up to one level higher than what you can normally cast, up to the sixth level. You cannot create more than twice the amount of Spell Slots that you would normally have available for any given level.

Additionally, when a Spell is cast within [1] of you, you may store the arcane energy as Sorcerous Overflow. Upon reaching three stacks of Sorcerous Overflow, you gain a Sorcery Point.

When a Spell is cast within [1] of you, you may store the arcane energy as <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="SORCEROUS_OVERFLOW">Sorcerous Overflow</LSTag>. The Spell cast must cost a <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">Spell Slot</LSTag> in order to do so. Upon reaching three stacks of Sorcerous Overflow, you gain a <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="SorceryPoint">Sorcery Point</LSTag>.
Affected creature is storing residual arcane energy. They will create a <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="SorceryPoint">Sorcery Point</LSTag> upon reaching three stacks of Sorcerous Overflow.
Spend <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">Spell Slots</LSTag> to gain <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="SorceryPoint">Sorcery Points</LSTag>. You may have up to 24 Sorcery Points at any given time.

Spend a level one <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">Spell Slot</LSTag> in order to gain 2 <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="SorceryPoint">Sorcery Points</LSTag>. You may have up to 24 Sorcery Points at any given time.

Spend a level two <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">Spell Slot</LSTag> in order to gain 4 <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="SorceryPoint">Sorcery Points</LSTag>. You may have up to 24 Sorcery Points at any given time.

Spend a level three <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">Spell Slot</LSTag> in order to gain 6 <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="SorceryPoint">Sorcery Points</LSTag>. You may have up to 24 Sorcery Points at any given time.

Spend a level four <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">Spell Slot</LSTag> in order to gain 8 <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="SorceryPoint">Sorcery Points</LSTag>. You may have up to 24 Sorcery Points at any given time.

Spend a level five <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">Spell Slot</LSTag> in order to gain 10 <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="SorceryPoint">Sorcery Points</LSTag>. You may have up to 24 Sorcery Points at any given time.

Spend a level six <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">Spell Slot</LSTag> in order to gain 12 <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="SorceryPoint">Sorcery Points</LSTag>. You may have up to 24 Sorcery Points at any given time.
Spend <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="SorceryPoint">Sorcery Points</LSTag> to gain <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">Spell Slots</LSTag>.
Spend 2 <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="SorceryPoint">Sorcery Points</LSTag> in order to gain a level one <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">Spell Slot</LSTag>.
Spend 4 <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="SorceryPoint">Sorcery Points</LSTag> in order to gain a level two <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">Spell Slot</LSTag>.
Spend 6 <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="SorceryPoint">Sorcery Points</LSTag> in order to gain a level three <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">Spell Slot</LSTag>.
Spend 8 <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="SorceryPoint">Sorcery Points</LSTag> in order to gain a level four <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">Spell Slot</LSTag>.
Spend 10 <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="SorceryPoint">Sorcery Points</LSTag> in order to gain a level five <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">Spell Slot</LSTag>.
Spend 12 <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="SorceryPoint">Sorcery Points</LSTag> in order to gain a level six <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">Spell Slot</LSTag>.

The maximum amount of Spell Slots you may create is equal to two times your normal limit within each Spell level. You may create up to one Spell level higher than what would otherwise be your natural limit.
While in combat, you gain one stack of <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="SORCEROUS_OVERFLOW">Sorcerous Overflow</LSTag> per turn.

Once per <LSTag Tooltip="ShortRest">Short Rest</LSTag>, you may use <LSTag Type="Passive" Tooltip="CreationaryText">Creationary</LSTag> to create <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="SorceryPoint">Sorcery Points</LSTag> or a <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">Spell Slot</LSTag> as a free action.

Gain the ability to spew <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Zone_BreathWeapon_Acid">Acid Breath</LSTag>. When you fail an <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag> with your Draconic breath, you still deal half damage. When dealing damage with a weapon, you deal an additional [1], equal to your levels in Sorcerer.

Gain the ability to spew <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Zone_BreathWeapon_Lightning">Lightning Breath</LSTag>. When you fail an <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag> with your Draconic breath, you still deal half damage. When dealing damage with a weapon, you deal an additional [1], equal to your levels in Sorcerer.

Gain the ability to spew <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Zone_BreathWeapon_Poison">Poison Breath</LSTag>. When you fail an <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag> with your Draconic breath, you still deal half damage. When dealing damage with a weapon, you deal an additional [1], equal to your levels in Sorcerer.

Gain the ability to spew <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Zone_BreathWeapon_Lightning">Lightning Breath</LSTag>. When you fail an <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag> with your Draconic breath, you still deal half damage. When dealing damage with a weapon, you deal an additional [1], equal to your levels in Sorcerer.

Gain the ability to spew <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Zone_BreathWeapon_Acid">Acid Breath</LSTag>. When you fail an <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag> with your Draconic breath, you still deal half damage. When dealing damage with a weapon, you deal an additional [1], equal to your levels in Sorcerer.

Gain the ability to spew <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Zone_BreathWeapon_Fire_Cone">Fire Breath</LSTag>. When you fail an <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag> with your Draconic breath, you still deal half damage. When dealing damage with a weapon, you deal an additional [1], equal to your levels in Sorcerer.

Gain the ability to spew <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Zone_BreathWeapon_Poison">Poison Breath</LSTag>. When you fail an <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag> with your Draconic breath, you still deal half damage. When dealing damage with a weapon, you deal an additional [1], equal to your levels in Sorcerer.

Gain the ability to spew <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Zone_BreathWeapon_Fire_Cone">Fire Breath</LSTag>. When you fail an <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag> with your Draconic breath, you still deal half damage. When dealing damage with a weapon, you deal an additional [1], equal to your levels in Sorcerer.

Gain the ability to spew <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Zone_BreathWeapon_Cold">Frost Breath</LSTag>. When you fail an <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag> with your Draconic breath, you still deal half damage. When dealing damage with a weapon, you deal an additional [1], equal to your levels in Sorcerer.

Gain the ability to spew <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Zone_BreathWeapon_Cold">Frost Breath</LSTag>. When you fail an <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag> with your Draconic breath, you still deal half damage. When dealing damage with a weapon, you deal an additional [1], equal to your levels in Sorcerer.

Gain the ability to use <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Zone_BreathWeapon_Force">Singularity Breath</LSTag>. When you fail an <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag> with your Draconic breath, you still deal half damage. When dealing damage with a weapon, you deal an additional [1], equal to your levels in Sorcerer.

Gain the ability to use <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Zone_BreathWeapon_Radiant">Scintillating Breath</LSTag>. When you fail an <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag> with your Draconic breath, you still deal half damage. When dealing damage with a weapon, you deal an additional [1], equal to your levels in Sorcerer.

Gain the ability to use <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Zone_BreathWeapon_Psychic">Psionic Breath</LSTag>. When you fail an <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag> with your Draconic breath, you still deal half damage. When dealing damage with a weapon, you deal an additional [1], equal to your levels in Sorcerer.

Gain the ability to use <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Zone_BreathWeapon_Thunder">Sonic Breath</LSTag>. When you fail an <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag> with your Draconic breath, you still deal half damage. When dealing damage with a weapon, you deal an additional [1], equal to your levels in Sorcerer.

Gain the ability to use <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Zone_BreathWeapon_Necrotic">Desiccating Breath</LSTag>. When you fail an <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag> with your Draconic breath, you still deal half damage. When dealing damage with a weapon, you deal an additional [1], equal to your levels in Sorcerer.

Dragon-like scales cover parts of your skin. You gain a +2 bonus to your <LSTag Tooltip="ArmourClass">Armour Class</LSTag> and the ability to <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Projectile_Fly_DragonWings">Fly</LSTag>.

You have become <LSTag Tooltip="Immune">Immune</LSTag> to the type of damage associated with your Draconic Ancestry. In addition, when you deal the type of damage associated with your Draconic Ancestry, you add your <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityModifier">Charisma Modifier</LSTag> to the damage total.
You have become <LSTag Tooltip="Immune">Immune</LSTag> to the type of damage associated with your Draconic Ancestry.
When you deal the type of damage associated with your Draconic Ancestry, you add your <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityModifier">Charisma Modifier</LSTag> to the damage total.
When dealing damage with a Draconic Breath action, you always deal the maximum damage possible.
You siphon your powers from the Shadowfell itself, the light in your soul snuffed out by an unsettling darkness.

Gain the ability to create clouds of <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_Darkness_Free">Darkness</LSTag> as a <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="BonusActionPoint">Bonus Action</LSTag>, as well as the ability to summon a <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_HoundOfIllOmen">Hound of Ill Omen</LSTag>. Your Hound is capable of cloning itself upon being hit, and grows in strength alongside you as you level. In addition, you gain the ability to see normally in darkness, both magical and non-magical, to a distance of [1].
Summon forth a hound of darkness.

Gain the ability to absorb the life force of your <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_HoundOfIllOmen">Hounds of Ill Omen</LSTag> and other summons. When your Hounds land a killing blow, you create one <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="SorceryPoint">Sorcery Point</LSTag>.
Upon landing a killing blow, the Sorcerer who conjured this Hound creates one <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="SorceryPoint">Sorcery Point</LSTag>.

Siphon the very soul from one of your <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_HoundOfIllOmen">Hounds of Ill Omen</LSTag> or other summons, killing them instantly and causing a necrotic explosion which deals [1] to all enemies in a [2] radius. You may also siphon other creature's summons as well. Upon siphoning a creature, you recover +1d12 <LSTag Tooltip="HitPoints">Hit Points</LSTag>.

As a <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_HoundOfIllOmen">Hound of Ill Omen</LSTag>, you may be absorbed in order to restore your Sorcerer's <LSTag Tooltip="HitPoints">Hit Points</LSTag>. Upon being absorbed, a necrotic explosion occurs, dealing [1] to all enemies in a [2] radius.

As a <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_HoundOfIllOmen">Hound of Ill Omen</LSTag>, you may be absorbed in order to restore your Sorcerer's <LSTag Tooltip="HitPoints">Hit Points</LSTag>. Upon being absorbed, a necrotic explosion occurs, dealing [1] to all enemies in a [2] radius.

Affected creature is affected by an Ill Omen. Upon dying, it will create one <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="SorceryPoint">Sorcery Point</LSTag> for the Sorcerer who's Hound applied this Condition.
Affected creature is just the worst kind of person!

You may now summon two <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_HoundOfIllOmen">Hounds of Ill Omen</LSTag> at once. Your Hounds may now cast <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_UmbralWarp">Umbral Warp</LSTag> as a free action, and have gained the <LSTag Type="Passive" Tooltip="ExtraAttack">Extra Attack</LSTag> passive.
Warp to an unoccupied, <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="SNEAKING_HEAVILY_OBSCURED">Heavily Obscured</LSTag> space.

Gain the ability to warp to an unoccupied, <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="SNEAKING_HEAVILY_OBSCURED">Heavily Obscured</LSTag> location within [1] of you as a free action using <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_UmbralWarp">Umbral Warp</LSTag>. Your <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_HoundOfIllOmen">Hounds of Ill Omen</LSTag> now create pockets of Darkness upon dying.
Upon dying, create a pocket of Darkness.

You may now summon three <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_HoundOfIllOmen">Hounds of Ill Omen</LSTag> at once. Your Hounds may now cast <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_HowloftheDamned">Howl of the Damned</LSTag> along with <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_UmbralWarp">Umbral Warp</LSTag>, and have gain an additional <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="ActionPoint">Action</LSTag>.
Howl, summoning shadow vines which potentially <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="UMBRA_ENTANGLED">Entangle</LSTag> nearby enemies.

While <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="SNEAKING_HEAVILY_OBSCURED">Heavily Obscured</LSTag>, all <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag> and damage rolls you make are rolled with <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag>. When your <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_HoundOfIllOmen">Hounds of Ill Omen</LSTag> clone themselves, their clones will never expire, and they can now produce further clones as well.
Searing heat broils within you, an ancient and irrevocable flame as unpredictable as it is uncontrollable.

When dealing damage, you ignore Fire based <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">Resistances</LSTag>. At the start of each of your turns, and upon landing a killing blow or <LSTag Tooltip="CriticalHit">Critical Hit</LSTag>, you generate one stack of <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="MAG_FIRE_HEAT">Heat</LSTag>.

When an ally is about to be damaged, you may expend one stack of <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="MAG_FIRE_HEAT">Heat</LSTag> in order to fire a <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Projectile_PyrrhicFlare">Pyrrhic Flare</LSTag> at their aggressor. In addition, killing a <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="BURNING">Burning</LSTag> or <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="BURNING_LAVA">Melting</LSTag> enemy will generate one <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="SorceryPoint">Sorcery Point</LSTag>.

When an ally is about to be damaged, expend one stack of <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="MAG_FIRE_HEAT">Heat</LSTag> in order to fire a <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Projectile_PyrrhicFlare">Pyrrhic Flare</LSTag> at their aggressor.
A flare so hot that upon landing, one might confuse the result with a small area of magma.

You gain Immunity to Fire damage. Upon dealing Fire damage while you possess stacks of Heat, you fire a Pyrrhic Flare at another enemy within [1] of your target.

Each Pyrrhic Flare fired will reduce your Heat stacks by 1, and each enemy may only be targeted by a Pyrrhic Flare if they are not Burning or Melting. This can be toggled at any time.
Once per combat encounter, you may immediately erupt, creating a [1] pool of lava beneath the feet of all enemies within [2] of you.
Erupt, creating a [1] pool of lava beneath the feet of all enemies within [2] of you.
Your <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Projectile_PyrrhicFlare">Pyrrhic Flares</LSTag> now cause enemies to <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="BURNING_LAVA">Melt</LSTag>.

Upon activating <LSTag Type="Passive" Tooltip="MAG_Fire_Heat_Convergence_Passive">Heat Convergence</LSTag>, you may expend ten stacks of <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="MAG_FIRE_HEAT">Heat</LSTag> in order to cast <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_MeteoricBurst">Meteoric Burst</LSTag>.
Release the latent power stored within you, destroying everything nearby!

Unruly magic sparks and fizzes through your veins.

When casting Spells at level one or higher, you have the potential to trigger a positive surge of uncontrollable magic, manifesting in random outbursts around and within you.

While this passive is active, you will no longer experience positive surges of <LSTag Tooltip="WildMagic">Wild Magic</LSTag>. Instead, casting a Spell on a creature within [1] of you has a chance of forcing them to experience a negative surge.

Affected creature will no longer experience positive surges of <LSTag Tooltip="WildMagic">Wild Magic</LSTag> when casting Spells. Instead, creatures within [1] of them may experience a negative surge when the affected creature casts a Spell which targets them.
Affected creature may potentially experience a negative surge of <LSTag Tooltip="WildMagic">Wild Magic</LSTag> when the Spellcaster who applied this condition casts a Spell on them.
Affected creature has a greater chance of causing a surge of <LSTag Tooltip="WildMagic">Wild Magic</LSTag>. This also applies when forcing other creatures to experience a surge.

When you land a killing blow or <LSTag Tooltip="CriticalHit">Critical Hit</LSTag>, the chance that your next Spell will cause a surge of <LSTag Tooltip="WildMagic">Wild Magic</LSTag> increases for three turns. This also applies when forcing other creatures to experience a surge.

When a creature you can see makes an <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag> or a <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag>, as a free <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="ReactionActionPoint">Reaction</LSTag>, apply a +/-1d4 bonus or penalty to the creatures roll.

You may now target both allies and enemies with <LSTag Type="Passive" Tooltip="CreationaryText">Creationary</LSTag>. Targeting a creature with Creationary causes them to experience a surge of <LSTag Tooltip="WildMagic">Wild Magic</LSTag>. Allies experience positive surges, while enemies experience negative surges. Enemies receive no beneficial effects from being targeted by Creationary.

When an enemy casts a Spell within [1] of you, you may spend your <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="ReactionActionPoint">Reaction</LSTag> in order to immediately trigger a positive <LSTag Type="Passive" Tooltip="WildMagic">Wild Magic Surge</LSTag> within yourself.
When an enemy casts a Spell within [1] of you, immediately trigger a positive <LSTag Type="Passive" Tooltip="WildMagic">Wild Magic Surge</LSTag> within yourself.

Within your grasp lies the untamed boundaries of the arcane.
A wellspring of creativity to tap into and mold as you see fit.

Spells and Cantrips which deal damage transmute an arcane shield across your body, granting you Resistance to elemental damage for three turns.

Costs [1] Sorcery Points per cast.
Affected creature is wreathed in a sorcerous, arcane shield, granting <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">Resistance</LSTag> to elemental damage.

Spells and Cantrips which deal damage leave your target Bleeding for three turns.

Costs [1] Sorcery Points per cast.

Allies will not be targeted by Spells and Cantrips that deal damage in an area.

Costs [1] Sorcery Point per cast.
Allies will not be targeted by this Spell.

Spells and Cantrips that deal damage cause an expansion of arcane armour to form over your body, granting you Resistance to physical damage for three turns.

Costs [1] Sorcery Points per Spell.
Affected creature is enveloped in arcane energy, granting <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">Resistance</LSTag> to physical damage.

Increase the range of targeted Spells and Cantrips by 50%. Melee Spells and Cantrips instead receive a range of [3].

Costs [1] Sorcery Point per cast.

Spells and Cantrips that deal damage potentially cause your targets to become Terrified.

Costs [1] Sorcery Points per cast.

Spells and Cantrips that deal damage make their damage rolls with Advantage.

Costs [1] Sorcery Points per cast.

Double the duration of conditions, summons, and surfaces caused by Spells and Cantrips.

Costs [1] Sorcery Points per cast.

Spells and Cantrips that deal damage, and which require an Attack Roll, make their Attack Roll with a +10 bonus.

Costs [1] Sorcery Point per cast.

Targets of Spells or Cantrips that require Saving Throws make their Saving Throw with Disadvantage.

Costs [1] Sorcery Points per cast.

Cantrips that deal damage deal the maximum amount of damage possible.

Costs 2 Sorcery Points per cast.

Spells and Cantrips that deal damage ignore all Resistances.

Costs [1] Sorcery Points per cast.

Spells and Cantrips that cost an Action require a Bonus Action instead.

Costs 2 Sorcery Points per level of Spell Slot used. Cantrips cost 2 Sorcery Points.

Spells and Cantrips that deal damage also restore your Hit Points. The total amount restored is equal to half the damage you deal.

Costs [1] Sorcery Point per level of Spell Slot used. Cantrips cost 1 Sorcery Point.

Spells and Cantrips that target a single creature provide the effects of Latent Restoration.

Costs [1] Sorcery Point per cast.

Spells and Cantrips that deal damage, and which require an Attack Roll, make their Attack Roll with Advantage.

Costs 1 Sorcery Point per cast.

Spells and Cantrips may be cast while Silenced or Muted.

Costs [1] Sorcery Point per cast.

Damaging Spells and Cantrips push your targets back by [1] and may cause them to fall Prone if they fail a Strength based Saving Throw.

Costs [2] Sorcery Points per cast.

Spells and Cantrips that only target one creature can now target two additional creatures.

Costs [1] Sorcery Points per level of Spell Slot used. Cantrips cost 3 Sorcery Points.
For Spells that don't fire a projectile, the targets need to be within [1] of each other.

Spells and Cantrips that only target one creature can now target an additional creature.

Costs [1] Sorcery Points per level of Spell Slot used. Cantrips cost 2 Sorcery Points.
For Spells that don't fire a projectile, the targets need to be within [1] of each other.

Upon landing a killing blow or <LSTag Tooltip="CriticalHit">Critical Hit</LSTag>, you create one <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="SorceryPoint">Sorcery Point</LSTag>. This effect can trigger once per turn.

After having used <LSTag Type="Passive" Tooltip="CreationaryText">Creationary</LSTag>, enemies within [1] of you roll with <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">Disadvantage</LSTag> when attempting to resist your Spells effects.
Affected creature is forcing enemies within [1] to roll with <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">Disadvantage</LSTag> when attempting to resist the effects of Spells.
Affected creature rolls with <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">Disadvantage</LSTag> when attempting to resist Spell effects.
Once per turn, casting a Spell creates one <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="SorceryPoint">Sorcery Point</LSTag>.
After having used <LSTag Type="Passive" Tooltip="CreationaryText">Creationary</LSTag>, Spells you cast add your <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityModifier">Charisma Modifier</LSTag> to their damage rolls.
Affected creature's Spells have their damage increased by a value equal to their <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityModifier">Charisma Modifier</LSTag>.

Gain <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">Resistance</LSTag> to all damage for as long as you have <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="SorceryPoint">Sorcery Points</LSTag>. Each time you are damaged by an enemy, you immediately lose one Sorcery Point. This can be toggled at any time.

While <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="FLANKED">Threatened</LSTag>, increase the damage of all <LSTag Tooltip="Cantrip">Cantrips</LSTag> and Spells you cast by your <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag>.

Using a Spell to deal elemental damage causes your target and enemies within [1] of them to suffer from a status effect dependant on the type of damage you dealt. This can be toggled at any time.

List of Effects

Elemental Afterglow Effects:

Acid Damage:
Acid

Cold Damage:
Frostbite

Fire Damage:
Burning

Force Damage:
Pull Creatures [1] Closer to Target

Lightning Damage:
Shocked

Necrotic Damage:
Bone Chill

Poison Damage:
Poisoned

Psychic Damage:
Mind Sliver

Thunder Damage:
Push Creatures [1] Away from Target

Radiant Damage:
Radiating Orb
Increase the <LSTag Tooltip="DifficultyClass">Difficulty Class</LSTag> of your Spells by 1.
Gain the ability to pull all creatures to a singular point of your choosing by expending two <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="SorceryPoint">Sorcery Points</LSTag>.
Pull all creatures to a singular point of your choosing.
When you or an ally are attacked by an enemy within [1] of you, force the target and aggressor to swap places as a free <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="ReactionActionPoint">Reaction</LSTag>.
When you or an ally are attacked by an enemy within [1] of you, force the target and aggressor to swap places.
Upon landing a killing blow, gain <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="MAG_GISH_ARCANE_ACUITY">Arcane Acuity</LSTag> for three turns.

When you start your turn while <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="FLANKED">Threatened</LSTag>, you may cast <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_MistyStep">Misty Step</LSTag> without expending a <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">Spell Slot</LSTag>.

When rolling with <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on your Spell based <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag> or <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag>, roll the damage of your Spells with Advantage as well.
When a creature within [1] of you casts a Spell, you generate two stacks of <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="SORCEROUS_OVERFLOW">Sorcerous Overflow</LSTag>, rather than one.
When damaged by an enemy, you generate one stack of <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="SORCEROUS_OVERFLOW">Sorcerous Overflow</LSTag>.

Gain the ability to expend one <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="SorceryPoint">Sorcery Point</LSTag> to gain <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on any <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">Ability Check</LSTag>.

After having used <LSTag Type="Passive" Tooltip="CreationaryText">Creationary</LSTag>, gain <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on all Spell <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag> for the rest of your turn.
Affected creature has <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on all Spell <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag> for the rest of their turn.

Gain the ability to receive <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="MAG_GISH_ARCANE_SYNERGY">Arcane Synergy</LSTag> at the expense of one <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="SorceryPoint">Sorcery Point</LSTag> per turn while in combat. This can be toggled at any time.

Affected creature is using one <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="SorceryPoint">Sorcery Point</LSTag> per turn while in combat to maintain their <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="MAG_GISH_ARCANE_SYNERGY">Arcane Synergy</LSTag>.
